New Records: Ryan Helsley notched his MLB-leading 42nd save in 45 tries
Key Match Events: Brendan Donovan hit a three-run homer to key a four-run third inning
Giancarlo Stanton came within inches of tying the score with a drive off the center-field wall
Juan Soto turned around Ryan Helsley's 101.5 mph fastball with a 114.3 mph rocket into the right-field corner for a double
Ryan Helsley retired the first two batters before walking Aaron Judge and then striking out Austin Wells with three straight sliders to end the game
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Ryan Helsley admitted that the club record for saves is a goal this season because it means the Cardinals are winning games
Cardinals manager Oliver Marmol marveled at Helsley's ability to lock in and be present in high-pressure situations
Kyle Gibson appreciated the sophistication that Helsley showed by using his finesse pitch to outwit the hitter
Miscellaneous Highlights: The victory was the Cardinals' first at the new Yankee Stadium and their first over the Yankees in the Bronx since Game 5 of the 1964 World Series
The play-by-play voices in 1964 and 2024 were both named Caray -- Harry 40 years earlier and Chip on Saturday
Coincidentally, St. Louis' winning pitchers in 1964 and 2024 were both named Gibson -- Bob in 1964 and Kyle on Saturday
Others: There are no other details mentioned in the article
